entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:40AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SALMON RIVER NEAR HYDER CONTINUES STEADY RISE... The Salmon River has been rising since Sunday due to warm temperatures at elevation causing snow melt into the basin and a possible release from Summit Lake. entry.summary: ...SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE THROUGH THIS EVENING... entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 6:05PM MDT until July 28 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR EAST CENTRAL ALBANY COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 615 PM MDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:50PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Albany and south central Converse Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 549 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Windy Peak, or 36 miles southwest of Douglas, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.
